data.title: Edelweiss A343 at Zurich on Apr 6th 2024, lost height immediately after takeoff
data.meta_description: Discover all inside details about what happened during airplane incident Edelweiss A343 at Zurich on Apr 6th 2024, lost height immediately after takeoff
data.text:
Last Update: April 6, 2024 / 21:23:04 GMT/Zulu time

Bookmark this article

Incident Facts

Date of incident

Apr 6, 2024

Classification

Incident

Airline

Edelweiss Air

Flight number

WK-24

Departure

Zurich, Switzerland

Destination

Cancun, Mexico

Aircraft Registration

HB-JMF

Aircraft Type

Airbus A340-300

ICAO Type Designator

A343

Airport

Zürich Airport, Zurich

Airport ICAO Code

LSZH

An Edelweiss Airbus A340-300, registration HB-JMF performing flight WK-24 from Zurich (Switzerland) to Cancun (Mexico), was departing Zurich's runway 16 at 13:04L (11:04Z) when the aircraft rotated for takeoff and became airborne, but sank back towards the runway nearly touching down again near the end of the runway before finally being able to climb out to safety. The aircraft is currently enroute to Cancun.

After becoming airborne the crew reported they had a tailwind on rotation.

According to preliminary information an investigation has been opened into the departure, a tailwind gust is being suspected.

The airline reported they have seen the video of this "unschöner Start" (eyesore takeoff), they first need to talk to the crew and assess the flight data when the aircraft returns from Cancun.
